sense.name: enter a new condition or state
sense.examples: The sky grew black as we headed the boat to harbor. The patient is growing sicker by the day. He changed jobs, grew a beard and bought a new sports car.

sense.name: normal physical development by natural processes
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 GROW Includes: GROW OVER
sense.examples: In these forests, mushrooms grow under the trees. He is growing a new variety of grape in his vineyards. They grew corn for livestock where I lived as a child. The ivy grew over the patio.

sense.name: human (emotional) development
sense.examples: Her son grew to his full height by age twelve. The girls grew from their experience helping the relief workers after the earthquake.

sense.name: increase or expand
sense.examples: Their business is growing fast. The responsibilities associated with this job have grown too large for me to handle. They saw a huge fireball growing across the eastern horizon.

sense.name: arise, originate
sense.examples: Their friendship grew over the years.

sense.name: specific way or process of development
sense.examples: Stalactites grow from the top of caves, and stalagmites grow from the bottom of them. Crystals grow as a lattice structure.
